abstracts.cdata!:
The program would help support the first
            phase (1985-1987) of the medium-term Economic Recovery
            Program (ERP) initiated by the Government in 1985. This
            first phase consists of a comprehensive set of policies and
            reforms aimed at (i) elimination of exchange rate and
            pricing distortions and (ii) retrenchment of the public
            sector in order to bring it into balance with the productive
            capacity of the economy. Specifically, the ERP program
            includes several measures. They are (i) exchange rate and
            pricing policy; (ii) agricultural pricing policy and
            institutional reforms; (iii) incentives for other productive
            sectors; (iv) far-reaching reforms of public administration;
            and (v) public enterprise reform. They also involve (vi)
            reorientation of the public investment program; (vii)
            financial sector reforms; and (viii) sustained pursuit of
            prudent fiscal, monetary and exchange rate policies. An
            economic adviser to the Presidency, currently being
            recruited under the special technical assistance program for
            IDA-only countries, would work closely with the
            Government's ERP Steering Committee to oversee
            implementation of the adjustment program.
